subject: Data
title: The Right to Be Forgotten
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Right to Be Forgotten.

hook.text: A Spanish man asked Google to remove a decades-old debt notice from search results. He won.

buildup.text: The 2014 EU ruling established the 'right to be forgotten' â€” individuals can ask search engines to delist outdated info.

discovery.text: Google has received over 1.5 million delisting requests since the ruling, approving roughly half.

twist.text: The right clashes with free speech. Criminals use it to hide convictions. Journalists call it censorship.

climax.text: The right to be forgotten raises a profound question: does your past data belong to you or to history?

punchline.text: Forgetting is human. The internet never forgets â€” unless forced.

quiz.question: What did the 2014 EU 'right to be forgotten' ruling establish?
options: All personal data must be deleted after 5 years
Individuals can ask search engines to delist outdated personal information
